content: As I'm doing more work on LLVM HEAD support, it occurred to me to wonder: what versions of LLVM do we care about? Obviously 13, and I care about HEAD, but do we care about older versions? If so, how far back?
We intend to support compiling with 10+ today (you can look for the CI builder that has llvm-X in the name to know which version)
cc @cuviper, who tends to care most about older LLVM support.
We don't have a specified policy here only a de facto one of n-2.or n-3 depending on moon alignment. See also Drop LLVM9 thread from earlier
Based on cuvipers requirements alone we could bump to llvm11 minimum now.
